enrichment.AboutCourse:
Our 38-week, full-time PGCE Secondary Science (specialising in Physics with Mathematics) programme will equip you with the skills, experience and knowledge you need to teach all three sciences and mathematics to Key Stage 3 and your subject specialism to Key Stage 4. \r
\r
In addition, we will help you to develop expertise that will enable you to teach all three sciences to Key Stage 4 (GCSE) and your subject specialism to Key Stage 5 (A level).\r
\r
Upon successful completion of your PGCE, you will graduate with Qualified Teacher Status (QTS) and 90 Master’s credits.\r
\r
[Find out more about this course](https://www2.uea.ac.uk/study/postgraduate/taught-degree/detail/pgce-physics-with-mathematics)
enrichment.Qualifications:
Prior to submitting your application, you will need:\r
\r
* A GCSE pass at grade C or an equivalent qualification in English language and mathematics\r
* IELTS 6.5 or an equivalent qualification, if your first language is not English\r
\r
Prior to beginning the course, you will need to have achieved a degree or its equivalent. As a general guideline, approximately 50% of the degree should be relevant to the subject you will teach. A degree classification of 2:2 or above is preferred in Physics or a closely related subject.
enrichment.FinancialSupport: Find out more about the Financial Support available within our [Essential Information section](https://www2.uea.ac.uk/study/postgraduate/taught-degree/detail/pgce-physics-with-mathematics)
enrichment.InterviewProcess:
Interviews are part of the formal selection process. You will need to present yourself well, come prepared, and dress smartly. Your interview day will include:\r
\r
* An introductory talk\r
* An individual interview\r
* A written task\r
\r
You may also be asked to complete other relevant tasks such as:\r
\r
* Working with small groups of pupils\r
* Giving a presentation\r
* A group interview\r
* Literacy, numeracy and subject knowledge questions\r
enrichment.OtherRequirements:
Prior to submitting your application, we recommend you gain some observational experience in a classroom environment if possible. This will help you gain an up-to-date understanding of how classrooms are managed and how teaching and learning takes place.\r
\r
If offered a place, prior to registration in September, all applicants will be required to:\r
\r
* Pass the [numeracy/literary skills tests]( https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/how-to-apply/passing-the-skills-tests)\r
* Obtain an Enhanced Criminal Records check from the [Disclosure and Barring Service](https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/disclosure-and-barring-service) \r
* Complete a satisfactory [health check]( https://static.hobsons.co.uk/uea/usermedia/UG%20Admissions%20Email%20Templates/Linked%20documents/UEAOccHealthQ.pdf). All PGCE trainee teachers must meet the Secretary of State's requirements for physical and mental fitness to teach.\r
enrichment.PersonalQualities:
Trainees are selected on the basis of their application form, references and an interview. You are encouraged to prepare thoroughly.\r
\r
Application forms should demonstrate strengths in subject and curriculum knowledge, your enthusiasm and commitment to a career in teaching, and the age range for which you have applied.
enrichment.HowSchoolPlacementsWork:
UEA’s PGCE Secondary programme places great emphasis on practical skills and the realities of classroom teaching.\r
\r
You will be based in schools two-thirds of the 38-week programme (120 days). \r
\r
The programme begins with structured observation in both secondary and primary schools in your local area. \r
\r
During the two extensive placements in our partnership schools, you’ll gain a broad range of practical teaching experience. You will learn to put ideas and theory into practice as you work in university and your two placement schools.

inst.TrainWithUs:
UEA is a top UK university with an international reputation for excellence in teaching and research. We're ranked among the top 200 universities in the world (Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2018). The 2019 Guardian University Guide ranked UEA 3rd in the UK for Education.\r
\r
The School of Education and Lifelong Learning is internationally recognised for the quality of its educational research. Our research has made a difference in schools across the country, influencing approaches to managing classroom behaviour, understanding students' motivation, and creating effective communities for learning.\r
\r
All of our PGCE tutors have experience of school teaching and leadership, and all are specialists in particular areas of the curriculum. You'll be well-supported throughout your PGCE, both during your time on placement and on campus.\r
\r
Imagine a career where you inspire, motivate, and unlock the full potential of those around you. Teaching is something that can truly make a difference.
inst.TrainWithDisability:
UEA operates an equal opportunities policy. Our Wellbeing Service offers a range of interventions including self-help resources, workshops and one-to-one appointments. \r
\r
Individual needs are catered for and can be discussed through the interview process. \r
\r
[Find out more about the information and advice available](https://portal.uea.ac.uk/student-support-service/wellbeing)
